moves.1. d4: the queens pawn opening send the pawn out defended by queen but only opens line for 1 development piece so is inferior to e4 is a better choice
moves.1... c5: I challenge the weak pawn immediately.
moves.2. d5: White has to waste a move dodging my attack, so I already have an advantage.
moves.2... e6: I attack the weakened pawn again
moves.3... Nf6: and I get a knight into play to challenge White's
moves.4. e4: and White has a strong looking center???
moves.4... d6: there has to be a catch, I have a lead in development that will triumph over White's center
moves.5. Bd3: that bishop is biting on granite
moves.5... Be7: and my bishop is better because has the d4-square
moves.6... exd5: but I get the attack strike first
moves.7. Bb5+: moves the same piece twice in the opening is not good choice
moves.7... Bd7: I get rid of bad bishop
moves.8. e5: but White tries desperately to recover from deficit
moves.8... dxe5: I have three pawns in the center in a mightily delightful style.
moves.9. Nxe5: but the knight took one but I still win
moves.10. Nxb5: White thinks he has recovered, but does not realize that my d-pawn is strong
moves.13. Nc3: so now I have extra pawn center going on to win
moves.14. Ne2: the knight blocks the other knight defense
moves.16... Bg5: I trade off the bishop that is the same color as my pawn chain
moves.18. f4: White wins piece but it is OK I get strong square e3 for the knight which is better than a rook
moves.20... Qxg5: I think the knight is better than the rook so I do not take
moves.21... Rfd8: And I move to play c4
moves.23... Rd1+: and if you are ahead by rook for knight, you should try to make trade rook for rook so that your two rooks are not redundant
moves.26... Qd2: and dominates controls everything with 1 rook vs 0 rooks I win easy but with 2 rooks vs 1 rook it is unusually confusing
